title: Impulse - clay thrown onto hard and padded walls

content.description: A piece of clay is thrown against a hard wall. The graph shows the horizontal component <math alttext="F sub h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>h</mi></msub></math> of the net force exerted on the clay during the collision as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>. How would the maximum of <math alttext="F sub h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>h</mi></msub></math>, the duration of the collision, and the area under the graph change if an identical piece of clay was instead thrown against a padded wall with the same velocity? Assume that both collisions are perfectly inelastic.
content.question: Maximum of <math alttext="F sub h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>h</mi></msub></math>Duration of collisionArea under graphAIncreasesDecreasesIncreasesBDecreasesIncreasesRemains the sameCIncreasesDecreasesRemains the sameDDecreasesRemains the sameDecreases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
